results.title: Australian tourism [advertisement]
results.brief_description: Developed by Mojo MDA for the Australian Tourism Commission this advertisement was part of the ‘come and say g’day’ campaign and features Paul Hogan in a range of locations across Australia. It also uses a range of Australian slang expressions including a play on the famous expression ‘put another prawn on the barbie’.

results.title: Lost in Translation
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
‘The double movement of displacement and circulation, loss and regeneration, constitutes a means of uncovering the disjunction between history and memory [in Latin America].’ - Charles Merewether.

The cartographer’s ‘invention’ of the world and the role of slavery in the process of the colonisation of South America form an ‘anti-historical’ reconstruction of ‘Brazil’.

Produced in association with the Australian Film Commission.
Notes reprinted courtesy of d/Lux Media Arts.
